intro: Valeriana rosaliana, commonly known as sweet valerian, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are usually pink or white, arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. Its roots are known for their aromatic properties and have been used in traditional medicine for their sedative effects. Valeriana rosaliana thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
